text: VV Cephei is a eclipsing binary star in the Cepheus constellation. It is 5,000 light years from Earth. VV Cephei A is one of the largest known stars, being a red supergiant. Its diameter is more than a thousand times that of the Sun.https://ui.adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/2008AJ....136.1312H It is orbited by VV Cephei B, a blue star with 1325 times the Solar radius. If VV Cephei A were placed in the center of our Solar System, its radius would reach past the orbit of Mars and the asteroid belt, nearly reaching Jupiter. ==Related pages== * T Cephei * MY Cephei * Mu Cephei * V354 Cephei * RW Cephei * VY Canis Majoris * U Lacertae ==References== Category:Red giants Category:Binary stars Category:Variable stars Category:Supergiants
title: VV Cephei
